name: Introduction to Anthropology
description: A general introduction to the field of anthropology, with an emphasis on the four primary subfields: biological anthropology, cultural anthropology, archaeology, and lingustics.

name: Introduction to World Cultures
description: An introduction to the study of human behavior and beliefs in different cultures around the world, including an overview of concepts such as culture, language, and religion.

name: Ethnography and Culture Theory
description: An exploration of the theories and methods of ethnography, the study of people in their cultural and social context. Topics include the history and contemporary practice of ethnography, culture theory, and cross-cultural comparison.

name: History of Anthropology
description: An introduction to the history of anthropology, with an emphasis on the development of anthropological theory and its relation to the history of the discipline.

name: Historical Anthropology
description: A detailed examination of the field of historical anthropology, focusing on the methods and theories used to study the past. Topics include archaeological research, historical linguistics, and the use of anthropological evidence to interpret the past.
